result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan M. Plaza
Current: 2609 Bush Ct Apt 3, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 01-31-2017)
Prior: 1925 Minnesota Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
  Cases heard are 15CM2, 15CM3, and 15CM26
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CM2: 30 days jail.  Pay court cost + Domestic Abuse + DNA surcharges.
15CM3 to be DRI.
15CM26 Count 1: 30 days jail, consecutive to each other. Pay court costs + DNA surcharges.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
No Contest to 15CM2, and 15CM26 Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Victim was given notice of hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM2 and 15CM26 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  15CM26 Count 2 and 15CM3 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc states there are 
44 days credit on 15CM26 and ask if balance of 15 days to apply to 15CM2 otherwise it 1 day credit on 15CM2.

Holly, Defendant's mother is present and Court questions her.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:***********JAIL********
15CM2: Spend 1 day in  jail.  Pay court cost + Domestic Abuse + DNA surcharges - 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 1 day credit
15CM26: 44 days jail.  Pay court cost + Domestic Abuse + DNA surcharges.  44 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM2, 15CM3

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas are entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bonds are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

$150.00 cash bond: 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Comply with all other coditions of bond in pending cases.

DA case #15PT18
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of  Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with same conditions as listed in 14PT2389.

BTC:  $150.00 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Comply with all other coditions of bond in pending cases.



Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  01-12-2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
